article_title: A verdict against Guo Feixiong is a verdict against China.
article_text:
On Friday my friend will face trial and likely be sentenced to prison in Guangzhou, a city in southern China. He has broken no laws. In fact, he is going to go to jail for saying publicly what many Chinese leaders have said publicly themselves. Yet the state will almost certainly deem him guilty of "gathering crowds to disturb public order." This prosecution carries dark significance for all of China.

My friend is Guo Feixiong, a legal activist whose real name is Yang Maodong. He has already served one five-year...

twitter.description: If China continues to take a hard line against human-rights activists like Guo Feixiong, Beijing's worst fears may soon come true.
twitter.title: A Dark Verdict on China's Future

image.alt: A verdict against Guo Feixiong would be a verdict against the Chinese regime's future.

article_metadata.author: Xiao Shu
article_metadata.article.origheadline: A Dark Verdict on China’s Future

article_summary:
In fact, he is going to go to jail for saying publicly what many Chinese leaders have said publicly themselves.
On Friday my friend will face trial and likely be sentenced to prison in Guangzhou, a city in southern China.
My friend is Guo Feixiong, a legal activist whose real name is Yang Maodong.
Yet the state will almost certainly deem him guilty of "gathering crowds to disturb public order."
This prosecution carries dark significance for all of China.
